casebody.data:
MARY A. EGAN v. EDWARD T. WALSH, et al.

Before Curtis, Ch. J., and Speir, J.

Decided February 2, 1880. Appeal by a receiver, from an order of the special term confirming the report of the referee appointed, to pass his accounts. Two charges for legal services were contested, one of which was reduced and the other disallowed by the referee. W. J. Lacey, for receiver and appellant. David Mitchell, for defendant. Per Curiam.

The order appealed from is affirmed, with $10 costs, and disbursements, to the defendants.
